author: bridge-bot
content: <yperbasis> What happened to the perfnet dashboard? Recently (yesterday) performance of most clients (except for "nethermind-modexp") went through the roof. E.g. `EcAddMarius1` for erigon went from about 60 MGas/s to about 1000 MGas/s.

author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> Trying to fix it now - tbh not sure what happened - maybe we didn't noticed we are lightning fast already? :D

author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> We fixed 2 issues yesterday which were causing from time to time that new changes weren't pulled properly and I guess one of the commits broken something but it is not clear yet which one so going through logs but are very verbose

author: bridge-bot
content: <KamilChNethermind> OK think I got it - was my small mistake while adding nethermind with repriced modexp which caused a domino effect. next iteration should work fine so please do not look at results from last ~20h.

author: bridge-bot
content: <vdWijden> @KamilChNethermind do you think we could have a dashboard for post-fusaka? To see the difference that the repricing makes? (Or just run the tests, I would like to double check that the repricing gets us safely to 100m for the modexp)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> re: **@vdWijden**
> @KamilChNethermind do you think we could have a dashboard for post-fusaka? To see the difference that the repricing makes? (Or just run the tests, I would like to double check that the repricing gets us safely to 100m for the modexp)
We can do it two ways:
1. Prepare a "proper" fusaka-performance branches - a bit more work here as we have some smaller issues which we need to tackle anyways but won't be super fast
2. Hacky way as @marcin_d_s did - custom branch which applies repricing now so we can check the outcome.

TBH the sooner we will make it the better as yesterday Marcin mentioned that there is some chance that it may still not cover all the paths properly but it may be then more about client improvements rather EIP repricing further.

author: bridge-bot
content: <amezianehamlat> 2. with a hacky way to apply new repricing seems reasonable to me, with pawel's update : https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9855/files
